thread.title: Union predicted to repeat as AAC champions
thread.title_full: Union predicted to repeat as AAC champions

title: Union predicted to repeat as AAC champions
text:
/ Headlines List / Article 
ASHEVILLE, N.C. - Head coach Kevin Burton and the Union College men's basketball team has been picked to repeat as regular season champions in the Appalachian Athletic Conference preseason poll, the conference announced on Friday. 
Receiving all 10 first-place votes, Union led the field with 100 voting points. Truett-McConnell (Ga.) is projected to finish second with 78 points, while Milligan (Tenn.) is third with 78 points. Bryan (Tenn.) (68 points) and Reinhardt (Ga.) (64 points) round out the top five. 
Making up the second five are: Tennessee Wesleyan (56 points), Bluefield (Va.) (49 points), Point (Ga.) (25 points), Montreat (N.C.) (20 points) and St. Andrews (N.C.) (19 points). 
The Bulldogs will look to win their third consecutive regular-season and tournament championship in the AAC. Union is 33-3 in AAC play during their last two championship runs. 
Burton and the Bulldogs are coming off an historic 2014-15 season, which saw the Bulldogs accomplish many milestones. Union finished with a 30-5 overall record, went 17-1 in league play and advanced to the round of 16 in the NAIA Division II National Championship Tournament with a 64-58 win over Northwestern Ohio. 
Union finished ranked 11th in the final NAIA Division II Coaches' Poll of the 2014-15 season. Also, the Bulldogs at one point had NAIA Division II's longest winning streak, which ended at 21 games (a school-record). 
Last year's team was hit hard by graduation as the Bulldogs only return four players from a season ago. Returning for the Bulldogs are AAC Defensive Player of the Year Gerrard Newby (JR/Lexington, Ky. ) and AAC First-Teamer J.D. Tucker (SR/Charleston, S.C.). The duo were also members on the AAC All-Defensive Team. 
The Bulldogs will open the 2015-16 campaign on Oct. 27, as they host Boyce (Ky.) in Robsion Arena beginning at 7 p.m. 
2015-16 AAC Men's Basketball Preseason Poll 1. Union (10)
